Description: Sculptor's trial piece: a limestone trial piece depicting an owl-hieroglyph (facing right), in elaborately detailed raised relief; the left side is lost.
Curator's comments: Such pieces by sculptors show the level of detail that could be incorporated into a single very common sign. Bibliography: Some similar pieces are probably votive offerings: R.S. Bianchi, 'Ex-votos of Dynasty XXVI', 'Mitteilungen der Deutschen Archäologischen Instituts Abteilung Kairo' 35 (Wiesbaden, 1979), 15-22; R.S. Bianchi,'Two ex-votos from the Sebennityc Group', 'Journal of the Society for the Study of Egyptian Antiquities' 11 (Toronto, 1981), 31—6; See also K. Myśliwiec,'Towards a definition of the "Sculptors Model" in Egyptian art', 'Etudes et Travaux' 5 (1972), 71-5. Published in: Regulski, I. (ed.), 2022. Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt, p. 49
Bibliographic references: Parkinson 1999 / Cracking Codes: The Rosetta Stone and Decipherment (32)
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
